title: RS21812
content: This report discusses the March 11, 2004 terrorist attacks in Madrid,Spain and their impact on Spain's March 14 parliamentary elections, which resulted in the surprise victory of theSocialist Party over the ruling right-of-center Popular Party. The report also examines some of the possibleimplications of the attacks and the elections for the U.S.-led coalition in Iraq, the war on terrorism and U.S.-Spainrelations. This report will be updated as warranted. See also CRS Report RS21794 , Iraq Coalition: PublicOpinionIndicators in Selected European Countries , by [author name scrubbed].
